description: A 3D surface f(x,y,z)=k with tangent lines illustrating partial derivatives ∂f/∂x and ∂f/∂y at a specific point. Show the planes y=constant and x=constant intersecting the surface.

A 3D plot showing several level surfaces of a function f(x,y,z) and gradient vectors drawn at various points, clearly illustrating that the gradient vectors are perpendicular to the level surfaces and point in the direction of increasing f.
A 3D region E (e.g., a sphere or a rectangular prism) with a small differential volume element dV highlighted, illustrating the concept of triple integration over a 3D domain.
